name: Milwaukee Athletic Club

reviews.text: A hidden gem. Enjoyed our stay---great location.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: Room service was delicious, hot, & fast. Kudos to Doug(manager) & the front desk. Would definitely stay here, again.
reviews.title: A Nice Find

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised as we were looking for a value-priced extended downtown stay on the East Side and found it in the MAC. Room prices at the MAC beat anything in our desired downtown location. Rooms (regular) were *very* spacious -- almost suites and we had two connecting rooms which made our 2 rooms into a very , very, arge suite. The rooms came with full guest priviledges at the athletic center (lap pool, well endowed weight/machine room, basketball court) which we used quite heartily -- our teenagers especially. The athletic center had lockers, showers, sauna as well. We walked to everything that we had planned -- the riverfront, restaurants, outdoor ice skating. The location was extremely convenient for us and even very quiet. There is a fire station right next door, but we only heard the firetrucks one time, and even this was not loud. There is a bar/restaurant on premises, which we did not visit, choosing other more respected choices (a good German restaurant called Karl Rautsches is next door). There is a review about the walls of the hotel being thin (not sound-proofed) -- we did not experience this.
reviews.title: A nice choice-and free use of athletic club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here last Saturday,Jan.7th..The room was big,and,beautiful!The shower worked perfectly,and,the staff was awesome...
reviews.title: Milwaukee athletic club magical

reviews.text: We had dinner in the "Elephant room"..I had bone in Rib eye,and, my wife enjoyed the Halibut..Both were delicious...A great place...
reviews.title: Nice staff - hotel is really, really not nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My experience started after a long day at work when I finally arrived at the hotel. The gentleman at the front desk that checked me in could not be more helpful or friendly. He made sure that I had the wi-fi access code, made very nice small talk and even gave me a toothpaste (TSA took mine). My room is was on the tenth floor,and when I got off the elevator, I knew I was in trouble.
reviews.title: Just okay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the finishes are from the mid-60s. What must have been a really beautiful ceiling has been replaced with 1950's type foam tiles that are typically used to cover up a major water problem, or years of smoking or both. My room was a nice size, but again, seemed to be 1000 years old. The carpet was old, the curtains looked like they had been hanging there since the Carter administration and all of the furnishings were clearly at least 30 years old.
reviews.title: Blast from the past

reviews.text: The bathroom looked to be the same vintage - 1960s- and not charming 1960s. It was all a pee colored tile. I have to say that all though dated, the place is most definently clean. The bathroom was emaculate, all of the grout was clean and in place and even the very old carpet was well cleaned - but 30 some years of hotel guests leave their mark and even though it seemed clean, it didn't give you a clean feeling. The room smelled like a Super 8 next to the interstate - the kind that have doors that open to the outside if you know what I mean...There was a flat panel TV with a pretty good cable TV channel selection, and my room had a clock radio with an Ipod capable dock.
reviews.title: Over rated!

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Milwaukee Athletic club. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location fit our needs perfectly. We enjoy walking all around the downtown and it was very centrally located. On friday night they had the rooftop bar open and it was a beautiful night with great views of the city.
reviews.title: Good Location, friendly staff, OK room.

reviews.text: Our room was large with a nice size bathroom. The room was clean but quite dated. The bathroom was done in yellow tile that I would say is from around the 1960's time period. The carpet and furniture were faded and worn.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay in downtown Milwaukee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were satisfied with the hotel for our needs and the price was reasonable.
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.text: private club in downtown Milwaukee. great for meetings, weddings, quiet getaways, and big parties. The rooftop deck is a hidden gem in the city. Nobody has anything like it in Milwaukee. Full athletic facilities, including 2 pools and a full basketball court. Rates are very reasonable and the food is great. Highly recomended.
reviews.title: Great Location, Good Price, Ok Room

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Milwaukee Athletic Club for an anniversary trip. The staff were really great: when I checked in at the front desk, the gentleman there (I believe his name was Doug) sang a little "happy anniversary" ditty, and then put us in a lake view room - that was a nice touch.
reviews.title: 5 Stars!!!

reviews.text: one of the hotels in the US with real character. Old fashioned but clean! perfect location and very sympathetic staff.
reviews.title: Charming and old school ... I love it !

reviews.text: Internet connection was the only negative.
reviews.title: Internet Problems, No Amenities
If you want to go back to a more elegant time

reviews.text: Stayed at the MAC for business and won't do so ever again. The internet service is iffy as with many older buildings that try to install wireless services. Don't try to get room service on a Monday night, either, because the MAC doesn't offer it and you'll be forced to walk to a local restaurant.
reviews.title: Very convenient location

reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was old, looked worn, and didn't really impress.
reviews.title: So many positives and so many reasons to go back & stay!

description: only available to guests attending a sponsored event
